      • testExactPConsistency

        Small sample no ties, exactP methods should agree

      • testExactPNoVariance

        public void testExactPNoVariance()
        Extreme case for ties - all values the same. Strict p-value should be 0, non-strict should be 1

      • testExactPSimpleSplit

        public void testExactPSimpleSplit()
        Split {0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1} into 3-sets. Most extreme is 0's vs 1's. Non-strict p-value for this split should be 2 / (6 choose 3); strict should be 0.

      • testTwoSampleExactP

        public void testTwoSampleExactP()
        Checks exact p-value computations using critical values from Table 9 in V.K Rohatgi, An Introduction to Probability and Mathematical Statistics, Wiley, 1976, ISBN 0-471-73135-8.

      • testTwoSampleApproximateCritialValues

        public void testTwoSampleApproximateCritialValues()

      • testPelzGoodApproximation

        public void testPelzGoodApproximation()

      • testTwoSampleApproximateP

        public void testTwoSampleApproximateP()
        Verifies large sample approximate p values against R

      • testTwoSampleProductSizeOverflow

        public void testTwoSampleProductSizeOverflow()
        MATH-1181 Verify that large sample method is selected for sample product > Integer.MAX_VALUE (integer overflow in sample product)

      • testTwoSampleMonteCarlo

        public void testTwoSampleMonteCarlo()
        Verifies that Monte Carlo simulation gives results close to exact p values. This test is a little long-running (more than two minutes on a fast machine), so is disabled by default.

      • testTwoSampleMonteCarloDifferentSampleSizes

        public void testTwoSampleMonteCarloDifferentSampleSizes()

      • testTwoSampleMonteCarloPerformance

        public void testTwoSampleMonteCarloPerformance()
        Performance test for monteCarlo method. Disabled by default.

      • testTwoSampleWithManyTies

        public void testTwoSampleWithManyTies()

      • testTwoSamplesAllEqual

        public void testTwoSamplesAllEqual()

      • testDRounding

        public void testDRounding()
        JIRA: MATH-1245 Verify that D-values are not viewed as distinct when they are mathematically equal when computing p-statistics for small sample tests. Reference values are from R 3.2.0.

      • testDRoundingMonteCarlo

        public void testDRoundingMonteCarlo()
        JIRA: MATH-1245 Verify that D-values are not viewed as distinct when they are mathematically equal when computing p-statistics for small sample tests. Reference values are from R 3.2.0.
